title: Indian Cabbage With Crispy, Crunchy Chickpeas Recipe
summary: Indian Cabbage With Crispy, Crunchy Chickpeas Recipe might be just the side dish you are searching for. One serving contains 178 calories, 2g of protein, and 14g of fat. This recipe serves 4. For 47 cents per serving, this recipe covers 11% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and vegan diet. Plenty of people really liked this Indian dish. This recipe is liked by 121 foodies and cooks. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 10 minutes. A mixture of salt, water to immerse and cover an inch above surface, section of ginger, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 62%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are Indian Cabbage with Crispy, Crunchy Chickpeas, Indian Spiced Kale And Chickpeas Recipe, and Crispy Indian Spiced Chickpeas.

winePairing.pairingText: Indian works really well with Gruener Veltliner, Riesling, and Sparkling ros√©. The best wine for Indian food will depending on the dish, of course, but these picks can be served chilled and have some sweetness to complement the spiciness and complex flavors of a wide variety of traditional dishes. The Nikolaihof Hefeabzug Gruner Veltliner with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 32 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Nikolaihof Hefeabzug Gruner Veltliner
productMatches.description:
#65 Wine Spectator Top 100 of 2012


This 2011 vintage is especially detailed and snappy and you seem to taste every pebble and each lee. Light but long, like spring water or a high-mountain white wine, with great aging potential.
